parameters: Ahmed told his mother about his day. The
phrases of control has come in handy a...
Ahmed
Mom, mom! Tell me more about those
phrases to tell yourself.
Madre_Ahmed
Well, I'll tell you right now.
Ahmed
Yessss! wow!
In addition to the control ones, which you have already used. There are 4
more types of phrases: sympathy, action, reflection
and valuation. Which one do you want to start with?
A
Sympathy
Action
Reflection
Assessment
Sympathy
These are used in social situations, as a rule
In general, no one wants to hurt us, but there are times
in which we think ill of people and say things to each other
like: "he laughs at me", "I can't stand this guy"... etc.
If we continually tell ourselves this, it makes us
let's get more angry In order not to talk to each other like that, we must say
phrases like: "be kind", "smile", "treat others
how do you want to be treated, "today for you, tomorrow for me"
Action
Reflection
Assessment
Action
These are for when we are demotivated, when
we have to do a task but we don't feel like it,
also when we have to face situations
what we don't want
In these cases we say phrases like: "after seeing
I do it on TV", "I'm bored", "I'll do it another day"....
If we keep telling ourselves this, it keeps us going.
do homework. In order not to talk to each other like that, we must say
phrases like: "first the obligation and then the
fun", "the sooner I start, the sooner I'll finish"...
Reflection
Assessment
Reflection
These are for when we act impulsively without
think about the consequences. We say phrases like:
"I answer the first thing that comes to mind", "it doesn't matter how
go out", "I do the first thing that comes to my mind"..
If we continually tell ourselves this, we will make mistakes
which we can regret.
In order not to talk to each other like that, we have to say phrases like: "for
and think", "do not rush", "think before you speak",
"get organized", "slowly", "I'll think about what I have
to do"....
Assessment
Assessment
These are for when we focus only on our
failures and the things that we are bad at. We tell ourselves
phrases like: "I have failed again", "I will never succeed",
"so much effort for nothing", "I always mess up"...
If we continually tell ourselves this, it makes the situation worse.
situation and we do not look for solutions.
In order not to talk to each other like that, you have to say phrases like:
"well done", "Great!", "I have less left", "the pro-
next time I'll get it", "I'm outdoing myself", "the one who
has a mouth is wrong"... etc.

and think", "do not rush", "think before you speak",

Action
These are for when we are demotivated, when
we have to do a task but we don't feel like it,
also when we have to face situations
what we don't want
In these cases we say phrases like: "after seeing
I do it on TV", "I'm bored", "I'll do it another day"....
If we keep telling ourselves this, it keeps us going.
do homework. In order not to talk to each other like that, we must say
phrases like: "first the obligation and then the
fun", "the sooner I start, the sooner I'll finish"...

These are used in social situations, as a rule
In general, no one wants to hurt us, but there are times
in which we think ill of people and say things to each other
like: "he laughs at me", "I can't stand this guy"... etc.
If we continually tell ourselves this, it makes us
let's get more angry In order not to talk to each other like that, we must say
phrases like: "be kind", "smile", "treat others
how do you want to be treated, "today for you, tomorrow for me"

Reflection
These are for when we act impulsively without
think about the consequences. We say phrases like:
"I answer the first thing that comes to mind", "it doesn't matter how
go out", "I do the first thing that comes to my mind"..
If we continually tell ourselves this, we will make mistakes
which we can regret.
In order not to talk to each other like that, we have to say phrases like: "for
and think", "do not rush", "think before you speak",
"get organized", "slowly", "I'll think about what I have
to do"....
